meanings.definition: A person who blinks frequently or excessively.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was full of blinkards, their eyelids fluttering constantly.
meanings.sent2: The blinkards in the audience made the speaker feel self-conscious.
meanings.sent3: The blinkards at the party kept missing the surprise moments.
meanings.sent4: The field of flowers looked like a sea of blinkards under the sun's rays.
meanings.sent5: The movie scene was so intense that even the blinkards couldn't look away.

meanings.definition: A group of people who blink in unison.
meanings.sent1: The synchronized swimmers moved like a graceful team of blinkards.
meanings.sent2: The blinkards in the flash mob amazed the onlookers with their coordination.
meanings.sent3: The blinkards in the choir blinked together to the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent4: The city square was filled with blinkards, creating a mesmerizing sight.
meanings.sent5: The blinkards in the parade blinked in perfect harmony, captivating the crowd.

meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but blinkards when the camera flash went off.
meanings.sent2: The bright light made him blinkards uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was so surprising that it made everyone blinkards.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline blinkedards with the lights of the skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks in the night sky seemed to blinkards in a magical dance.
